document.title: Pennsylvania Department of Education 6th Grade Assessment Anchors and Eligible Content

8F5A82300D8B43B8BD6C380FE0043CF4.description: Relate the choice of measures of center and variability to the shape of the data distribution and the context in which the data were gathered.

7111819D4A5A4BDD8ADD95F08F8F4E40.description: Compare points in a line plot, histogram, or on a number line.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

60E3CB59C695451284C93A3512CC77FB.description: Describe any overall pattern and any deviations from the overall pattern with reference to the context in which the data were gathered.

41AB8BAE62B64FB6AFC75FE6BC19CDCF.description: Identify measures of central tendency (mean, median, mode).Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

921F69490EC44D78A23247F1ACE3D01D.description: Determine quantitative measures of center (e.g., median, mean, mode) and variability (e.g., range, interquartile range, mean absolute deviation).

50B7D27CE3894640B87209ED5CDAC07C.description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including line plots, histograms, and box-andwhisker plots.

3991B98B59214ED5AC945DE19E449F77.description: Display, analyze, and summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.

147FE7323EFD497B963C3E5C64ABD8CB.description: Demonstrate understanding of statistical variability by summarizing and describing distributions.

FBA54CCA29F94F05A6C44828CFD70729.description: Determine the surface area of triangular and rectangular prisms (including cubes). Formulas will be provided.

89B5436183544784A25F366CECEBDB4A.description: Classify three-dimensional figures.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

95E318FC85254CB5BD31446E7EF804F1.description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made of rectangles and triangles.

C516037717BF43FEB27F2627CBDC1E56.description: Given coordinates for the vertices of a polygon in the plane, use the coordinates to find side lengths and area of the polygon (limited to triangles and special quadrilaterals). Formulas will be provided.

B3C8BB72E41D476392911085FA1FBCC1.description: Solve a real-world problem involving volume using unit cubes or multiplication.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

D22B6F2FE5EB46A18EBE6CDC518EA63C.description: Determine the volume of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths. Formulas will be provided.

EBECD3A5F22F42A58A91EAC63E5FB908.description: Determine the area of irregular or compound polygons. Example: Find the area of a room in the shape of an irregular polygon by composing and/or decomposing.

B9268B0A5D104D83AA38FF19D4BCA21F.description: Find the area of a quadrilateral given the dimensions.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

9D57AFB723FC49D8AF01681897DF8567.description: Determine the area of triangles and special quadrilaterals (i.e., square, rectangle, parallelogram, rhombus, and trapezoid). Formulas will be provided.

C269203507DA4A81BD1072E0A4469472.description: Find area, surface area, and volume by applying formulas and using various strategies.

5846A2C824FD445A9AF56612222C3810.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.

756AD7DDBFF34182B343F5E6932A0442.description: Analyze the relationship between the dependent and independent variables using graphs and tables and/or relate these to an equation.

9C25494C8851467DB717197CF2F25081.description: Identify the relationship between two variables in an equation.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

00FB8C9C1C6F4F28A556E5AEF9D940C1.description: Write an equation to express the relationship between the dependent and independent variables. Example: In a problem involving motion at a constant speed of 65 units, write the equation d = 65t to represent the relationship between distance and time.

60793E79D935418B940F89E2000B6683.description: Use variables to represent two quantities in a real-world problem that change in relationship to one another.

7DFB4852409240C2B3D3DAFC170F96C5.description: Represent and analyze quantitative relationships between dependent and independent variables.

D777217E27B24733BD99BD6D938F8BA7.description: Write an inequality of the form x > c or x < c to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem and/or represent solutions of such inequalities on number lines.

9F95CA5EBD864EBE99175BDC08F95556.description: Use a 1-step algebraic expression to solve a real-world problem involving addition or subtraction of whole numbers.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

CCB46E8C997E4082BACDF56C4D59C9F1.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations of the form x + p = q and px = q for cases in which p, q, and x are all non-negative rational numbers.

2737FC9359E343D18F4B9F2A3C7C006E.description: Select an algebraic expression involvingaddition or subtraction of whole numbers to solve a 1-step real-world problem.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

F14C33756B9345A087FDAD5D708E726B.description: Write algebraic expressions to represent real-world or mathematical problems.

B6C13F34B45E4513A5E2308F58A76E27.description: Use substitution to determine whether a given number in a specified set makes an equation or inequality true.

8C2B8CDDDE4C4B70957359400C399CEA.description: Create, solve, and interpret onevariable equations or inequalities in real-world and mathematical problems.

443B1826E4FA469783A491B45FBD5EED.description: Interpret and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.

68E8C7A958F247DF864B25731959595F.description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions. Example 1: Apply the distributive property to the expression 3 (2 + x) to produce the equivalent expression 6 + 3x. Example 2: Apply the distributive property to the expression 24x + 18y to produce the equivalent expression 6(4x + 3y). Example 3: Apply properties of operations to y + y + y to produce the equivalent expression 3y.

7E6DB26B4BEC4F7E8B5BAED7DA0D21CC.description: Evaluate expressions at specific values of their variables, including expressions that arise from formulas used in real-world problems. Example: Evaluate the expression b^2 – 5 when b = 4.

0F4DA7F436674907AF8051C5830166AE.description: Identify parts of an expression using mathematical terms (e.g., sum, term, product, factor, quotient, coefficient, quantity). Example: Describe the expression 2(8 + 7) as a product of two factors.

03E92D7E831C4F41BFC52A3B58FACA21.description: Write algebraic expressions from verbal descriptions. Example: Express the description “five less than twice a number” as 2y – 5.

85934DA0F607421EBB6BF392DE4DFD05.description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

93812C601E5C450F89A7C426E3562358.description: Identify, write, and evaluate numerical and algebraic expressions.

55416208AEFB4C6087F7DFA197565D5A.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to numerical and algebraic expressions.

6450A1B75705489699BC8713101892CB.description: Calculate a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

D9C2857D2BF0469B9142403CBDE28F24.description: Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percentage.

6B7DFBC3817E4496AD70DF17DE9C5D71.description: Solve a 1-step real-world problem given the unit rate.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

151A52AF3705465EAD4E2B6FBBAFFB41.description: Solve unit rate problems including those involving unit pricing and constant speed. Example: If it took 7 hours to mow 4 lawns, then at that rate, how many lawns could be mowed in 35 hours? At what rate were lawns being mowed?

A64436B5FDFC4EF5B3DDF02D16579196.description: Construct tables of equivalent ratios relating quantities with whole-number measurements, find missing values in the tables, and/or plot the pairs of values on the coordinate plane. Use tables to compare ratios.

DAB0B23C8BA643C4AE6ED69C79C1A74C.description: Identify the ratio that matches a given statement and/or representation.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

7805205E0FBA427F93E3A60ED401CD7A.description: Find the unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b (with b ≠ 0) and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship. Example 1: “This recipe has a ratio of 3 cups of flour to 4 cups of sugar, so there is 3/4 cup of flour for each cup of sugar.” Example 2: “We paid $75 for 15 hamburgers, which is a rate of $5 per hamburger.”

E1CF2AB2749F48F49A8543B2AC31CC40.description: Use ratio language and notation (such as 3 to 4, 3:4, 3/4) to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities. Example 1: “The ratio of girls to boys in a math class is 2:3 because for every 2 girls there are 3 boys.” Example 2: “For every five votes candidate A received, candidate B received four votes.”

9CB72E421ACA4C688DD3DEC7BE3D6E09.description: Represent and/or solve realworld and mathematical problems using rates, ratios, and/or percents.

CAD8F061640B47348EB8BD20E4B45D34.description: Understand ratio concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.

7CA166533B1244CEBEB9825F25763A8B.description: Identify points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

D856E5FD5EE4400BA7CAF755FB95D215.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by plotting points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane. Include use of coordinates and absolute value to find distances between points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.

EFA83E7BC7D049ECA955D3DD72885B8F.description: Interpret the absolute value of a rational number as its distance from 0 on the number line and as a magnitude for a positive or negative quantity in a real-world situation. Example: For an account balance of –30 dollars, write |–30| = 30 to describe the size of the debt in dollars, and recognize that an account balance less than –30 dollars represents a debt greater than 30 dollars.

6D9D1E69830546038C04A7CE5017F1D9.description: Write, interpret, and explain statements of order for rational numbers in real-world contexts. Example: Write –3°C > –7°C to express the fact that –3°C is warmer than –7°C.

112F4E707D3F4A4C84F8632C4D825718.description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

86D3AC976F8343E099D453FA2E24FD37.description: Locate positive and negative numbers on the number line.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

15A4B3ACCBBD43A9A5D07450321F639C.description: Locate and plot integers and other rational numbers on a horizontal or vertical number line; locate and plot pairs of integers and other rational numbers on a coordinate plane.

23DA6678D573413993EB6E11CB07D5E9.description: Identify the opposite of a number onthenumber line.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

9B8A05F5A23F4ED79A9B394D75D1FB1E.description: Determine the opposite of a number and recognize that the opposite of the opposite of a number is the number itself (e.g., –(–3) = 3; 0 is its own opposite).

BC7320B94D2F49839DD3F89DBC3858B7.description: Identify a specific integer in a real-world context.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

5DF1E67CDBB44E3C90E1E4EE37967DEC.description: Represent quantities in real-world contexts using positive and negative numbers, explaining the meaning of 0 in each situation (e.g., temperature above/below zero, elevation above/below sea level, credits/debits, positive/negative electric charge).

A7D8290F89A6499D9E7ECD7473AF292C.description: Understand that positive and negative numbers are used together to describe quantities having opposite directions or values and locations on the number line and coordinate plane.

645090F3F1D94F0CACBDB6B016D03DAD.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.

00FA01260A544AC4913A91F768154298.description: Apply the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers, 1 through 100, with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor. Example: Express 36 + 8 as 4(9 + 2).

AB9A153769D74ED0AA95233CF21564BD.description: Identify multiplesfor numbers 5, 10, 25, or 100.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

EBCE22569219441FAAD692F9AE1078A4.description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12.

C74222AE8D664914823CF19A75019996.description: Apply number theory concepts (specifically, factors and multiples).

B922D5BEC1E947C8A5D8DEAD0A74CB15.description: Solve a problem using up to 3-digit whole numbers and any of the four operations.Alternate Eligible Content is designed for students assessed using the PA Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). Essentialized Example resources assist teachers in designing instruction that reduces content complexity while maintaining alignment to academic standards.

F25976130F82476A9CC8DC38BECE2C36.description: Solve problems involving operations (+, –, ×, and ÷) with whole numbers, decimals (through thousandths), straight computation, or word problems.

9AF309C5658942859A6FBA9700859FB9.description: Compute with multi-digit numbers using the four arithmetic operations with or without a calculator.

6E4022EAE0EA4CD39EDA0469A0261AC1.description: Compute with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.

90607966DA0D4E2DBFC3B76A0DCEBAA1.description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions (including mixed numbers), and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions. Example 1: Given a story context for (2/3) ÷ (3/4), explain that (2/3) ÷ (3/4) = 8/9 because 3/4 of 8/9 is 2/3. (In general, (a/b) ÷ (c/d) = (a/b) × (d/c) = ad/bc.) Example 2: How wide is a rectangular strip of land with length 3/4 mi and area 1/2 square mi? Example 3: How many 2 1/4-foot pieces can be cut from a 15 1/2-foot board?

A45A8ED5ABDF48EBB984E7FF1C996A0F.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving division of fractions.

13D8C0B089974BBF8B84229E53336C4A.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division to divide fractions by fractions.
